metadata.Title: CVE-2023-7192 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
[netfilter: ctnetlink: fix possible refcount leak inctnetlink_create_conntrack()]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-7192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-79-generic - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-5.15.0-79-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-79-generic - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-79-generic-64k - 5.15.0-79.86
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-25-generic - 6.2.0-25.25~22.04.2

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.15.0-79.86').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
linux-hwe-6.2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-25.25~22.04.2').
